pullRequest.body:
Those two definitions are completely obsolete now that we have the pointwise API. This PR removes them but not the corresponding API. A much more tedious subsequent PR will be needed to merge the two API.

Note that I need to tweak simp lemmas to keep confluence since I'm merging two pairs of head keys together.

---

I am in favour of merging this PR. But I think we should also make serious work of implementing notation for right actions that keeps the action visibly on the right. The version using `op` will eventually lead to extremely confusing expressions, I'm quite sure.
This looks great, but it's probably worth a second opinion.

I am in favour of merging this PR. But I think we should also make serious work of implementing notation for right actions that keeps the action visibly on the right. The version using `op` will eventually lead to extremely confusing expressions, I'm quite sure.
I think the module docstring should explain that `a â€¢ s` is a left coset and `op a â€¢ s` a right coset, using similar terminology to before; it just no longer belongs in a "definitions" section

```suggestion
Properly merge with pointwise actions on sets, by renaming and deduplicating lemmas as appropriate.
```
Please mention the corresponding notation in the additive setting.

I think this is a little clearer with bullet points:
```suggestion
When `G` is a group and `a : G`, `s : Set G`, with  `open scoped Pointwise` we can write:
* the left coset of `s` by `a` as `a â€¢ s`
* the right coset of `s` by `a` as `MulOpposite.op a â€¢ s` (or `op a â€¢ s` with `open MulOpposite`)

If instead `G` is an additive group, we can write (with  `open scoped Pointwise` still)
* the left coset of `s` by `a` as `a +áµ¥ s`
* the right coset of `s` by `a` as `AddOpposite.op a +áµ¥ s` (or `op a â€¢ s` with `open AddOpposite`)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Remove `leftCoset`/`rightCoset`
